com.github.cwilper.fcrepo.dto.core.io
Class DefaultContentHandler

java.lang.Object
  com.github.cwilper.fcrepo.dto.core.io.DefaultContentHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
ContentHandler
public class DefaultContentHandler
extends Object
implements ContentHandler

A ContentHandler that allocates files in a single local directory, using the filename pid + dsId + dsVersionId and sets the datastream contentLocation to a the corresponding file:/// URI.

If the pid is null, that portion of the filename will be a unique string starting with nopid: and ending with a numeric value.

Initially, the directory to write to will be a new, temporary directory as provided by File.createTempFile(String, String). The directory to use can be overridden via setBaseDir(File) before the handler is used.

Content that is written will be automatically deleted when the handler is close()d, unless setAutoDelete(boolean) is called beforehand.

Method Detail

setBaseDir

public void setBaseDir(File baseDir)
Sets the base directory. If the new base directory is different from the current one and autoDelete is true, the current base directory's will be deleted. The new base directory need not exist yet. If it doesn't exist, it and all parent directories will be created the first time it's needed.

Parameters:
baseDir - the new value, never null.
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the value is null.

setAutoDelete

public void setAutoDelete(boolean autoDelete)
Sets whether the base directory's contents should be deleted when this handler is closed or a new base directory is set.

Parameters:
autoDelete - the new value.

handleContent

public OutputStream handleContent(FedoraObject obj,
                                  Datastream ds,
                                  DatastreamVersion dsv)
                           throws IOException
Description copied from interface: ContentHandler
Handles the content of the given DatastreamVersion.

An implementation MAY:

  • Modify the fields of the given FedoraObject, Datastream, or DatastreamVersion.
  • Opt out of having the content stored, in which case it should return null.

A typical implementation of this method will allocate a file to which the content may be written, set the datastream version's content location to the URI of that file, and return an OutputStream so the caller may write the content.

Specified by:
handleContent in interface ContentHandler
Parameters:
obj - the object containing the datastream.
ds - the datastream containing the datastream version.
dsv - the datastream version whose content is to be handled.
Returns:
the sink to which the caller should write the content, or null if the caller should not write the content. If non-null, the caller is expected to close the stream when finished writing the content to it.
Throws:
IOException - if the content cannot be handled for any reason.

close

@PreDestroy
public void close()
Description copied from interface: ContentHandler
Releases all resources associated with this handler. This can be safely called multiple times.

Specified by:
close in interface ContentHandler
